meanings.definition: A layer of dirt or froth on the surface of a liquid.
meanings.sent1: The pond had scums floating on top.
meanings.sent2: She skimmed off the scums from the soup.
meanings.sent3: The scums on the lake looked like tiny islands.
meanings.sent4: The scums in the bathtub seemed to multiply overnight.
meanings.sent5: The scums in the sink were a disgusting sight.

meanings.sent1: He avoided the scums who always caused trouble.
meanings.sent2: The town was plagued by scums who vandalized property.
meanings.sent3: The scums at the party were loud and obnoxious.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was surrounded by scums in the crowded room.
meanings.sent5: The scums in the group made it hard to enjoy the gathering.

meanings.definition: To remove scum from a liquid.
meanings.sent1: She carefully scums the impurities off the broth.
meanings.sent2: He scums the foam off the freshly brewed coffee.
meanings.sent3: The chef scums the excess fat from the stew.
meanings.sent4: They scummed the debris from the surface of the pool.
meanings.sent5: The machine efficiently scums the waste from the water.
